newsitem.title: JAPAN: NCB affiliates' debts total 2.025 trln yen - Teikoku.
newsitem.headline: NCB affiliates' debts total 2.025 trln yen - Teikoku.

text.p: Nippon Credit Bank Ltd's three nonbank financial affiliates have total debts of 2.025 trillion yen, the private credit research firm Teikoku Data Bank said on Tuesday.
The bank said earlier on Tuesday that the three nonbank financial affiliates had filed for bankruptcy at the Tokyo District Court.
A spokesman for NCB said the affiliates filed for bankruptcy on Tuesday but he did not give details, such as the scale of their debt.

Last week, NCB said it expected to unveil a restructuring plan in early April. The bank did not provide details of the plan but banking sources have said it would include sales of real estate and the closure of some operations overseas.
Japanese media reports have said that the plan would also include the disposal of problem loans held by NCB's troubled nonbank financial affiliates.
